str2: Then, thereafter, afterwards. From epi and eita; thereafter.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
(a) of two: another, a second, (b) other, different, (c) one's neighbor. Of uncertain affinity; other or different.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: How much, how great, how many. From an absolute pos and hos; interrogative pronoun how much (plural) many).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: Or, its prolonged form opheileo probably from the base of ophelos; to owe; figuratively, to be under obligation; morally, to fail in duty.
One hundred. Of uncertain affinity; a hundred.
(Hebrew) a (dry) measure, equivalent to 120 gallons. Of Hebrew origin; a cor, i.e. A specific measure.
Wheat, grain. Also plural irregular neuter sita of uncertain derivation; grain, especially wheat.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Middle - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To take, receive, accept, welcome. Middle voice of a primary verb; to receive.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From grapho; a writing, i.e. A letter, note, epistle, book, etc. plural learning.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to 'grave', especially to write; figuratively, to describe.
Eighty. From ogdoos; ten times eight.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
